website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy but lightweight stroller with exceptional features and handling at an affordable price tag.
pros: We love that it is easy to open and maneuver, and is compact but well-built
Parents appreciate the 4 seating positions for little ones and bonus features like a shade canopy and storage basket that aren't always offered in lightweight stroller styles
cons: A few users experienced issues with the front wheels, and some found the canopy to be too small

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is larger and taller than basic umbrella strollers. It reclines and also has a huge storage area underneath. View my picture to see how it compares to our basic umbrella stroller. I bought as an open box special and it had no damage at all! Woo hoo.
customer_reviews.author: Af01soccer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined after using it 3 times
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this stroller but after using it 3 times the shade is crooked and wont stretch out completely. I'd love to have the shade replaced but I could not find where to request a replacement part. I'm in S California, so the shade on the stroller is very important.
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product description!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I guess for what it is it's fine, but it's not what my wife ordered. The product description is actually for the Summer Infant 3Dpac CS+ Compact Fold Stroller, which allows the use of car seats. It was based on this that my wife ordered it. Because of this, we need to send it back... but because it's crammed in the box so tightly, we nearly destroyed the box pulling it out, and spent 20 minutes just trying to cram it in back the box and taping it back together. Don't know who's responsible for adding product descriptions, but they REALLY need to pay more attention to what they're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harvey

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS STROLLER
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS STROLLER.!! You are wasting your money. I had purchase this strollernfor my grandson back on May 26, 2017. He only weights approximately 30 pounds which is below the recommended weight limit for this stroller, the tire is coming off the rim twice already. You call up Consumer Service of the company and they mail you a replacement wheel. As I stated this the second time it has happened. And it happens at the most worst times. Like when you at the Bronx Zoo or in the city. Now you have to lug the damage stroller and a toddler. It's not fun.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Eng

customer_reviews.title: Good but lacks sun protection
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is convenient for shopping and other indoor travels. As for outside strolling, the "canopy" does NOT provide shade; even with the additional shade flap. My daughter is extremely fair and I am constantly applying sunscreen. You can see in the pic beside a friend's stroller (with her canopy NOT EVEN extended!!) the amount of shade her sons received versus the shade my daughter (Fully extended with sun shade flap extended too!!). Its a good, lightweight stroller, just would prefer the canopy do a better job at providing shade.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Olden

customer_reviews.title: We loved this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We loved this stroller! We bought it before our trip last Summer. It was light weight, easy to fold, reclined nicely, and was easy to push (perfect for the plane)! Fast forward to a year later (we only used it a few times after our trip), the silver lining part is peeling and the latch in the back does not stay down, it pops up randomly:( Such a bummer, we wanted to use it for our upcoming trip but won't chance it since I'm not sure how secure it will be with the back latch popping up. Overall, not worth it since it lasted less than a year with minimal use:(
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and good maneuverability
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was a great choice for us. It's very light weight and can be folded/unfolded in a second. Assembly was a bit tricky but not difficult by any standards if you follow the instructions. It has good sturdy wheels but shock absorption is low. If you hit the bump fast, your baby will feel it. Due to the light weight construction, the stability is slightly compromised. The wheel brakes are great. Handles are just fine. Comes with cup holder and rack to store baby stuff. Overall satisfied with this stroller and makes life easier for us and the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Lover

customer_reviews.title: Worn out after little use
customer_reviews.text: Only two months of moderate use, the stroller wheels have begun obnoxiously squealing, to the point that I alternate lifting the front and rear wheels off the ground to catch a break. Shortly after this, the lock bar on the rear right side snapped off. We take care of our purchases, so I'm quite disappointed to see this product that I paid almost $100.00 for, break down so quickly. Of course, when I get on Amazon to see if I can make a return, I've missed the return window by a few days, even though these product defects manifested well within the refund time-frame.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Tall enough for a 6' parent
customer_reviews.text: Finally, an affordable compact stroller that's tall enough for this 5'11" guy to push without hunching over! We have the "Mini" version as well, and that's just a tad short for me, though fine for my wife. The "Lite" lets me stand upright. Yay! Overall high marks. Folding is a two-step or two-hand process, but still very easy. Only notable shortcoming: the canopy doesn't extend very far, so some kind of add-on is needed for shade during extended outings on scorching summer days.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Cornell

customer_reviews.title: A great lightweight stroller
customer_reviews.text: We take our cutie all over the place in this stroller. For a lightweight stroller, we are happy with the quality. The handles are tall enough to be comfortable for my 6’ tall husband but also comfortable for me (I’m considerably shorter). Fits easily in our van. I can open and close it while holding baby (after a little practice). The cup holder is a joke, but we don’t need a cup holder so we don’t really care about that. The only complaint is that the sun shade is pretty much useless. It doesn’t shade his face at all. Overall, it’s a good value.
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Truly, the most bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: There’s a lot of quality here for the money. Smooth ride, great for short or tall parents, super comfortable for kids... my daughter is big for a one year old, but this stroller can accommodate the space she will need for years to come. Folds and unfolds easily... I wasn’t expecting the stroller to be so big though. It definitely takes up more space Folded than the Maclaren I use to have. The sun shade kinda sucks... always sun in my kids face, I’m gonna have to buy an extender but still a 5 star, so much value here without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Cynnamon

customer_reviews.title: Works well once assembled
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions not as clear as they should be. The wheels have to be put on in a certain way and this is not stressed in the instructions. Once on there is a special two person procedure needed to remove the wheel. I had to contact customer service to find out what this procedure was as it was also not covered in the instructions. Collapsing the stroller is not as easy or well indicated as it should be. Other than these gripes the stroller seem to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Fizzie

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller to travel with
customer_reviews.text: We recently travelled by air and purchased this so that I could push my baby around through terminals and have space in the basket to carry his diaper baby. Its perfect for him not so much for storage. This stroller allows babies under 6 months old to be pushed in it. It was lightweight and easy to fold. I could easily fold and unfold with one hand while holding my son The basket was just too small for his diaper bag. I just hung it up with hooks instead. I was flying alone with him for the 1st time and this made it really easy to do things on my own. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: hbn45

customer_reviews.title: canopy warped in hot car
customer_reviews.text: I had been enjoying this stroller - it is lightweight, not the easiest to take apart and fold up, but not so bad. Until this past weekend when the heat in our car somehow totally warped the canopy! Not like it provided a ton of shade anyways, but will have to see if we can even use it anymore. Really disappointed. How does it melt in a hot car?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaves red marks along the child’s spine.
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed. I bought this so my son could be comfortable while going to museums and fairs. Instead the back is so hard it’s like he has a board on his back. And he gets red makes along his spine from the seat. I would not recommend this to parents.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best everyday and travel stroller there is. Our first one lasted 5 and a half years and the only reason we replaced it was that we drove over it and the front wheels got messed up. Still, even after driving over it we used it for a long time. We have take it to endless overseas trips and used it for 3 kids. It is also great for taller people: i am 5'9" and can push it very comfortably and my husband is 6'2" and has no problem using it. This is a steal for the quality and the price!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Rowe

customer_reviews.title: I like this... BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Truly love this stroller!! My ONLY complaint is the sun shade/visor. It does NOT block the sun well. We took it to Florida and although it is easy to push (even used it in the sand near the water), it did not protect our little from the sun, at all. We actually bent the visor forward, pretty much breaking it, so that it would protect her better. I do like it, however, I wish it was more versatile in that way. Love that it is lightweight, easy to fold, and has the compartment underneath and sleeve in the back. It also reclines well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tall and love it! You can stop looking now.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t ask for a better stroller! I’m 5’11 and my husband is 6’3 it’s a perfect height for us to comfortably use. Purchased it as a recommendation from my sister in law. We used it for traveling. Baby is 3 months old so I wanted a light weight stroller that was tall enough, comfortable for baby, had storage below and for a water bottle.. as well as one that declined back for sleeping baby. Couldn’t have asked for more! It also has a sun shade that even extends! Got it as a n open box deal which was the topping on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Babylo1

customer_reviews.title: really liked it until the wheel broke :-(
customer_reviews.text: wheel broke after about a month - returning it. very bummed
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Went from a bulky stroller to this one for my newly turned 1 year old and could t be happier! It’s super easy to assemble( put on wheels and cup holder) love the reclining feature and the sun visor. It’s also super compact and fits great in the back of my SUV leaving so much more room in the trunk for storage. Also a plus that we got the open box version for only 52$!! Definitely a steal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for travels.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this stroller for 3 years, I just have to say it’s the best travel stroller I’ve owned. I initially bought it for a European vacation. We went from Germany, to Croatia, and then England to Ireland. That was 7 flights over the course of 1 month. The stroller did amazing! I did by a compatible sun protector, because the visor on this stroller doesn’t cover much. I also just recently bought a skateboard, to go with this stroller, we are taking another vacation this time with a 4 year old and 1 year old. And the skateboard is the perfect addition to this easy travel stroller.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer backs their product!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller. I use it for my everyday commute to/from daycare since my LO was 4 mos old. We wanted something light that could easily fold in the already packed daycare stroller closet. Also take note when one of the foam handle covers had a tiny rip from being hung on a hook, I called the manufacturer to see if they would send me a replacement handle cover. They sent me a BRAND NEW STROLLER to replace it instead and paid for me to ship the old one back!
customer_reviews.author: karin s.

customer_reviews.title: Tall enough!
customer_reviews.text: While I have yet to give it a real road test - nasty weather and all that - my grandson and I have taken the stroller out for a spin and found it very useful. I am 5'12" and this is plenty tall for me! It took a moment for this Ikea-challenged person to assemble it out of the box, especially as there are no instructions, but the only tool you need is a blade to cut the tie line holding it together. Otherwise, it comes together nicely. I am not crazy about the plastic wheels (as opposed to rubber) but for the price, definitely RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Guida

customer_reviews.title: buy it, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stroller. this was my third stroller to buy because the other two just weren’t working for me. so i crossed my fingers in hopes this one would work. & IT DID!!! My 2 month old loves to sit up. the two point harness helps him to sit and and look around. this stroller also leans back far enough that he can go to sleep. it’s super lightweight, isn’t big & bulky, & easy to unfold and fold up. if your doubting this buy, DON’T! you’ll love this stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Brandon

customer_reviews.title: An honest review
customer_reviews.text: Quite happy with my stroller. Its lightweight like I wanted. However the seat is made from very very hard material. No comfort at all. The raincover/ sun cover doesn't cover my baby from the sun nor rain. It comes just behind her head. I was on the bus took my baby out (had no shopping or bags on the stroller either. It was completely empty) and it kept falling over. Which leads me to believe my stroller is a little off balance without my baby in it. I love the strap on the side. Its convenient. But hoping to change this stroller for something more comfortable and practical in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Beemee

customer_reviews.title: Nice, tall handles, don't need to stoop over to push this one!
customer_reviews.text: Just tried out my stroller, at the mall, for the first time. Loved how tall the handles were (I'm 5'7"). My husband will even be able to push this one without having to stoop over. Pushed easy, had a nice amount of space underneath for the diaper bag. Loved that it laid all the way back for an easy nap. I think this is the best "umbrella" stroller I've ever had and my baby is my 9th kid.
customer_reviews.author: M Wag

customer_reviews.title: great for travel little space used
customer_reviews.text: We used this on our trip to Florida from Las Vegas with one-stop. It was surprisingly super lite and easy to fold and carry. We rented a small car and were able to fit our luggage and this stroller all together without sacrificing the front seat. I would definitely recommend this for any new parents like us who want something dependable and easy to adjust. I would say the only issue is storage but you are not using this stroller like our every day stroller only for vacations and trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Francia

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!! Amazing quality & functionality!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased based on the reviews and am pleased to confirm I am 100% satisfied and so happy I bought this stroller!! We wanted something to easily bring along to the zoo for when our 3 year old begs to be carried. The quality is excellent and the functionality & design are beyond what I expected. This is a wonderful stroller for what you pay!! And honestly I wish I had gotten it a couple years ago! It will for sure come in handy for a while still. So glad I picked this stroller!!
customer_reviews.author: Hello Jojo

customer_reviews.title: Great to use everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stroller. I purchased for use in the airport. Quick and easy to fold for security check. Quick and easy open after exiting plane. The cup holder doesn’t always stay attached. I store this stroller in my trunk and sometimes the cup holder is knocked off from other items in my trunk. Since I purchased, I've used at the zoo, walks around the neighborhood, and just about anywhere else you can think of. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy

customer_reviews.title: A solid value
customer_reviews.text: For the price of about 75 bucks, this is a great value. I was a bit skeptical with the price being so low but I did not want to get ripped off for one of the bigger name brands, as we were buying right before a trip. It is reasonable on weight and sturdiness. Our son found it comfortable enough as the reclining is good and he was able to nap on occasion. The storage area is a decent size and it does not topple easily.
customer_reviews.author: M. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Missing cup holder
customer_reviews.text: I am writings this review highlighting the experience buying used with amazon warehouse. I don’t know how to contact them. I bought this used with description item will be delivered in original packaging, packaging will be broken. I am fine with that. But when item arrived it missing cup holder?!?! I tried to contact amazon warehouse so that they can give the missing item but i can only see return/replace item option. As for the stroller: It’s not as light as I expected, feel bumpier on a uneven path compare to my graco stroller However it is tall enough for a taller person
customer_reviews.author: Just a reg customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, won't last, and very uncomfortable ride.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes it would work is pretty much an umbrella stroller. it was trashed in less than a year from traveling and we didn't travel that much. It also was very rickety on sidewalks and the poor baby was jerked around a lot. I ended up trashing it six months later and purchased another stroller that was way better. Britax agile stroller. that thing was not much more money way more durable and easier to collapse. We still have it 2 years strong now and it's gone to Mexico and Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: Fatoom

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive stroller to use with my grandson so that we could take daily walks. This stroller exceeded my expectations. It is light, easy to push, and maneuver. Since we are in the pandemic, I avoid people and often take it on grassy, clumpy areas and it handles that unevenness well. Overall pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R Dice

customer_reviews.title: Took a beating in Europe and held up great!
customer_reviews.text: From Colorado to Paris, Venice, Parma and Geneva on cobblestone streets, planes, trains, boats and everywhere else, this sturdy stroller held up on our two-week European vacation. That alone made it worth its price. It was easy to fold, the basket below was a handy carrying receptacle, and the wheels maneuvered well on those crazy, rough streets. It's still ticking back home. My only complaint is that when it was assembled, the left front wheel didn't touch the ground. We couldn't figure out how to fix that, but on three wheels it worked great anyway. Definitely get the check travel bag if you're flying with it somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy-Not Cheap, a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. The wheels are rubber so it rolls over packed dirt roads/trails easily. It is light, very sturdy, easy to fold and travel with, great storage under, and has several seating positions that my 4 month old loves. I am giving it 4 stars because there is no cushion for baby and the canopy could be lower to block more sun. To assist with these issues, we add a cushion to the seat and purchased a canopy extender. Both were inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: ARW

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: Alright, this may be the best “umbrella stroller.” It has high handles so you don’t have to lean over. People with the traditionAl umbrella strollers will be so freaking jealous. Also has a cup holder, carry strap, and underneath storage! This is extremely durable. There is a reason that we saw them all over Vegas, San Diego, and Orlando! They are awesome! It’s definitely worth the extra money as opposed to a traditional one. Also, I have no problem collapsing it, but my husband just mastered it after owning it for damn near a year. The only thing is I wouldn’t use this for a new baby.
customer_reviews.author: 1sttimeMomWendi

customer_reviews.title: like the zoo or aquarium
customer_reviews.text: This is our second stroller. Our first is a jogger that we use alongside this one. We needed a smaller stroller for summer trips in crowded areas, like the zoo or aquarium. The jogger was simply too big. This stroller was priced well for what we needed and it retains the benefit of dropping the back into the laying position. Most umbrella strollers do not. It’s very easy to compress and expand, although I was a bit concerned upon arrival that it required some assembly. It was easy to put together, though. I wonder how long my relatively short 18mo old will be able to use it; the seat depth seems fairly shallow. Hence, 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Louisiana Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy comfortable stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking light weight stroller. I like that it's sturdy and once folded it locks so you can pick it right up without it reopening. Trying to place your foot on the the latch to initiate the fold can be a little tricky though. The storage space at the bottom is sufficient. My son seems comfortable in both the upright and reclining position. I haven't had problems with the wheels going awryn when steering. I have lost the cup holder... That comes off a little too easy when putting this in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, not holding up well
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it this stroller was amazing. Over the months (less than 6) it is showing major wear. The wheels wobble, the front wheels pull left or right and sometimes won't turn. The height on it is amazing. As a 6 foot 1 inch guy this stroller is the tallest I have found. I wish the wheels and axels were of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella stroller + benefits!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable umbrella stroller that still had some of the perks of a big travel stystem and this hit the mark! It has a bigger shade than most umbrella strollers, but could still do with a little bigger or maybe more adjustable. I love that the back can recline so my kid can take a snooze. And it’s great that there is a mesh pocket to hold things. Only downside about the pocket is that when the seat is reclined, you can’t access the pocket. Not the end of the world, but would be better if you could also access from the side.
customer_reviews.author: MWashington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance of sturdy and portability
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is great. My son is 2 so only wants to be in a stroller sometimes. Its not bulky like your off road stroller but not flimsy like an umbrella. Trust me I know, I have both of them along with this one! Dont get me wrong having the big bulky one comes in handy once in awhile but this stroller is perfect. Its fits nicely in a vehicle. Even a tiny one. Is light weight, yet durable. With a cup holder and even underneath storage! The wheels are sturdy too. Hope this review helps parents out there :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and great for travel
customer_reviews.text: A bit of a pain to fold and unfold, but yuh pull get used to it. Otherwise comfortable for baby with thoughtful storage behind and below. We had a problem with assembling it (my fault) and manufacturer sent replacement promptly and at no charge. Easy to store in trunk., but may be too large for small car. Fold flat and is lightweight. Fairly easy to travel on airplanes. Recommend buying carrying bag for airline trwvel. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: If you believe in yourself you can put 2 kids in this stroller
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a light travel stroller you can walk all over Chicago with a 6 and 2 year old jammed in look no further! I assumed my 6 year old would be into a walking tour of the city and boy was I wrong but no worries this stroller accommodated my poor planning. Only thing to keep in mind is if you have a $15 bottle or Rose from Whole Foods in a bag on one of the handles and your kids suddenly abandon ship you will have a broken bottle of wine on the sidewalk and you will be sad.
customer_reviews.author: Anna from MN

customer_reviews.title: not light weight and portable at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for our 15 months old son to use on trips to the mall or parks, thinking this is a more portable stroller and easier to use now that i don't need a full size stroller. This stroller did not feel any lighter or more portable than our Graco's stroller. It's very bulky and hard to fold/unfold. Materials are cheap and not very sturdy. My son did not feel comfortable when he's sitting in it at all, he looked stiff and uncomfortable after 20 minutes or so sitting in it.
customer_reviews.author: WinWin

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: Folds up nice and slim, yet still has nice features like the three angles, good mobility and basket underneath (decent size). I LOVE the ease of the straps which stay connected (individual arm/lap) to each other which makes buckling my 5 mo in and out a snap. Cons are the sharpness of the fully upright angle and the handles go up just a tad high for me (5'6") but overall an awesome stroller. I bought it to replace the original travel system stroller since I recently bought a double stroller and my trunk was full of strollers! I now keep this one and the double in the trunk and still have room for groceries etc (I have a compact SUV).
customer_reviews.author: Jackie H.

customer_reviews.title: Popular & Lightweight Stroller - The Canopy Needs Work
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a Thanksgiving trip to Hawaii and overall were happy with the purchase. We saw this model everywhere on our trip - very popular. The stroller is lightweight, easy to get the child strapped in and remove, the storage is adequate. My only complaint was the canopy - for sun protection is is basically worthless unless it is high noon. The canopy folds flat and extends out just barely over the kid's head. It does not hinge at the stroller frame allowing it to be adjusted at low angles. It was very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great midsize stroller
customer_reviews.text: We really like this stroller. We had a huge Graco Click-Connect but it took up so much room in our SUV. We also had umbrella stroller and my husband and I are both tall and we had to stoop over just to push it. I saw this stroller while we were at the St Louis Zoo and it looked awesome so I ordered it and used it on our next big outing and I was so glad I ordered it. Works great in gravel and our son was comfortable and we still have storage. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I just can not express how much I love this stroller! I just purchased my second one. I used the first one so much, that the rubber was completely gone from the wheels! Lightweight, perfect for traveling through airports! You are able to fold, unfold, and carry all with one hand!!! The design is perfect. Would be an amazing baby shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller!! I would recommend a rain fly for traveling to keep baby dry as the sun sheiks doesn’t offer much of any protection (sun or rain wise). We took this on our vacation to Paris last fall and it was a life saver. So lightweight we could easily fold it up to carry when needed but great for pudding baby. The back lays almost completely flat which was wonderful for naps as well as diaper changed on the go. 10/10 recommend! Great lightweight travel stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Angeline Life

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Bought This Sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stroller. I used to use a city mini but it was too bulking for the car, and then tried a simple umbrella stroller, but the handles were way too short and the wheels never turned correctly. This is absolutely my favorite stroller. I'm 5'10" and my husband is 6'3", the handles are not adjustable, but they're tall enough for both of us to push the stroller without it feeling awkward or hurting our backs. It rides so smoothly and I've even jogged (slowly) with it and the wheels didn't vibrate. I highly recommend it. Wish I had put it on my baby registry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to maneuver but not easy to collapse
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is lightweight and maneuverable but it is NOT easy to collapse--takes both hands and some serious effort---so be sure to secure your toddler prior to trying to close this thing up! I like the fact my toddler can get himself into the seat and I like the 4 wheels --but the seat is fairly shallow and canopy is too small to provide any shade or protection to the seat--material is durable and easy to clean-- but doesn't breath so baby's back gets pretty sweaty after a short time. The 'cup holder' is a throw away...and pretty much pointless. but it is lightweight....and once finally collapsed doesn't eat tons of space
customer_reviews.author: AmyCQ

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller for disney world In April. Decided to test it out at a local park yesterday. The stroller took about 5 minutes to assemble and was very easy. Pretty good handle and was even able to push it across different terrain with ease. My only complaint is that the foot rest is pretty flimsy and I could feel my toddler tapping her feet in the wheels. It looks nice and hs a generous size basket underneath. I like it a lot better than my Chicco lite way!
customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight stroller!
customer_reviews.text: The quality and durability of this little stroller is great! I purchased it to have a more lightweight option to keep in the vehicle for everyday trips. It glides and steers very smooth. The carrying strap is nice when you need both hands for other items. The handles are up nice and high, unlike other small strollers that feel more like babydoll strollers😆 I would definitely recommend this for other parents!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Compromise
customer_reviews.text: We have a nice Britax Agile stroller, but wanted a lighter stroller to take with us on vacation (on airplane). Bought the Summer Infant 3D Lite. The stroller worked better then expected. It was very light, worked well, and held up well (survived four flights so far). Was really surprised how many features it has considering how much it costs and how light it is. Really like that the seat reclines flat and has lots of storage underneath. Zips around nice is does well on stairs. Great comprise between the bigger strollers and an umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nuna stroller for my 2year old which I love bc it’s super comfy and folds all the way back for him. However, I needed a lightweight stroller since we were traveling. After some research, I decided to go with this stroller and I love it. It’s not as comfy or padded as a full size and heavy stroller but it’s soo convenient. While traveling, my son only slept in it since he wanted to be on his feet to explore. I would recommend this stroller for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa R Leyva

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight stroller!
customer_reviews.text: We don’t use a stroller super often, but this is perfect for when we need one quickly and on the go! It’s very lightweight, and folds up extremely easy! I have a small car and it fits in my trunk or backseat perfectly! One thing I was looking for in a lightweight stroller is one that would recline so that my daughter could nap if she needed and this one is perfect! It reclines pretty far, not all the way flat but just enough to be comfy! I love it, my daughter loves it. So I’m happy!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older child - bought for Disney trip!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is exactly what I was looking for to take to Disney world, but I already love just using it around the neighborhood. It’s lightweight & easy to maneuver. It folds up very easily and is nice and compact. This won’t be a problem at all to transport at the airport on getting on and off buses at Disney. There is enough room for my 5 year old to sit very comfortable. And I’m happy with the storage compartment! You can fit quite a bit given that this is a compact stroller. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my five month old granddaughter. I love it! My daughter has an uppababy. I can not see how those things are worth $600. This stroller is lightweight, easy to turn and looks great. I even bought the used- good condition one from the warehouse. They sell them at discounted price because box is little damaged. Item in excellent unused condition. Holds her perfectly and reclines.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT. 5'5 and husband 5'8 2-3yo toddler
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE everything about this stroller is definitely "tall" for me to push unlike other umbrella strollers I feel Like I am crouch down and have a hunch back.... and I am just 5'5 (on a good day lol). The shade is awesome as well gives the awesome coverage, the maneuver is very light and easy. love how it has the lock on the front wheels to make it a solid straight drive or unlock for a 4x4 mobility. as soon as it is fold down, it locks automatically. wish i bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: EsmeraldaZ

customer_reviews.title: Great take-along stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect umbrella stroller! If you're tall, this is an awesome stroller. No more hunching over to walk your child. The handles come to a perfect height! We use it for quick trips and travel as it folds up in a fairly light and easy to carry way. While the shock absorption isn't as amazing as my running stroller, this is a light, comfy, and convenient option for my child when we don't want to lug around the big stroller. The storage at the bottom is also nice. Plenty of room for my giant diaper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: This is a great stroller! I wanted something lighter than my standard ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller! I wanted something lighter than my standard size stroller, but still sturdy, large enough for a growing toddler, and with a basket. This fits the bill and was easy to assemble. Perfect for traveling. I really like that it locks when folded and has a carrying handle. The cons are minor but do exist: The cup holder is small and awkward, and it is definitely not a one-hand task to open and close. Easy to forget how to close if you don't use it for a bit! I'd still highly recommend for something that is functional without the extra weight provided by the standard size strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: I really like this umbrella stroller
customer_reviews.text: I really like this umbrella stroller. A little bigger than the typical umbrella stroller but the extra features make up for it. We have another "higher quality" quick fold stroller that we completely got rid of after buying this. It closes up tight, has a larger shade than most umbrella strollers, and my favorite feature is that it can recline to multiple levels, which our previous did not do (it only laid flat and straight up). The basket underneath holds more than expected. Overall would definitely recommend for a compact stroller on the go.
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: Right price for lightweight travel
customer_reviews.text: This was a great stroller for the airport! Lightweight, easy to collapse and open. Storage space is pretty good. Was surprised to use/appreciate the arm strap. Drawbacks: sunshade is limited so it does not provide great sun coverage. Drink holder attaches/detaches too easily and is off to the side so it is something you need to be aware of (taking it off / making sure it doesn't fall off when collapsed) - one thing I don't want to have to think about.
customer_reviews.author: Kmary

customer_reviews.title: Held up well to lots of travel!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller about two years ago and have taken it on a couple plane trips - most recently to Europe. It handled the old cobblestone streets of little tourist towns all over Belgium and Germany like a champ, and this after it already had some mileage on it. When our 2.5 year old fell asleep, we lowered the back down so he could nap on the go. Storage space on the bottom held bags and bottles of water etc. Just a great stroller that is a good midway point between the super cheap disposable strollers and the giant ones that you wouldn’t want to travel with. You get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. It was extremely easy to assemble..took 5 minutes and required no tools. Stroller is very lightweight and easy to fold. It handles very well. Turns easily and the basket underneath was the perfect size for a diaper bag. I wasn’t sure what to expect of such an inexpensive stroller. I only bought it because my niece moved here and her stroller hasn’t been shipped yet. It was just to fill in until her belongings arrived. But she likes it better than the one she had. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller for traveling. We have taken this all over the U.S., Germany, London, Austria, Budapest, Poland and plan on taking it more places. Its the perfect size and you are able to maneuver all around small areas. It does good on cobble stone not perfect but not bad. It is a 2-step fold but its not hard. My little one seems comfortable in it doesn't cry or get cranky and is able to take some good naps in it. The carrying strap on it is pointless and too small, we never use it. The storage compartment is a decent size. The shade could be better. Easy to put together and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wanted a jogging stroller but this is much better. My other stroller was cute but when it came to practicality it was heavy and hard t fold and the wheels wiggled. This stroller is lightweight and folds back so my infant can sleep. It is also nice and tall so my husband and I do not feel like giants pushing it. I would buy this again. I also love that I easily put it together when it came in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: jessica miavon hackman

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller but will not block the sun
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller for our trip to Disneyland. We liked that it handles very easily and is super light weight. It handles very smoothly. The material is good and the basket underneath is a bonus. We did not like that it didn’t block the sun and provide shade - we ended up buying a sunshade for the stroller. I was very worried about our little one getting sunburned, so I bought this stroller since it has the extended sunshade, but even with that down, only our 1 year olds face was shaded. Overall though, it’s a good buy for the price - and if you buy a stroller sunshade with it, i’d Recommend this stroller
customer_reviews.author: JenK

customer_reviews.title: great for tall people and for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: great stroller for tall people. easy to tote around on travel. a few drawbacks, no single handed recline. straps are a little tricky to adjust with a squirming toddler, center of gravity is a bit to the rear, so you shouldn't latch your diaper bag to the top part of the handles; stick it in the basket - although the basket opening is a bit limited. i just end up carrying the diaper bag. that being said, this was a godsend for me while traveling alone with my LO. easy to operate and beyond adequate to get the job done. definitely a top choice umbrella stroller for tall people. i'm 6'1" and the other ones left me hunching over.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: We returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Super lightweight and love that it reclines. It also handels great. We also loved the price. This would be a great umbrella stroller if it weren't for a few design flaws which led us to return it. 1. The hood is too far up and not big enough. It's actually pointless and doesn't protect baby from sun. 2. The seat is too small and shallow and it looks and feels like the child is sliding out forward out of it. 3. Pain in the butt to fold up. If your child is older this may be a good option. Not good for smaller babies. My daughter is 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: D.AdamsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: BEST. STROLLER. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller!! It is perfect for all of our kids (aged 5 months thru 4 years old)! It is very easy to push in the grass and is extremely light weight! I can't recommend this stroller highly enough! Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell how many miles I did with this stroller and it is still doing very good. Easy to fold and even easier to unfold. Of course it is light and simple, so if you are looking for a stroller with plenty of pockets and places to put things this is not the one, but it does have some place on a compartment below the baby (separated, of course) and you can buy additional holders and hooks to strap to the stroller to carry more things, like a bag, a cup of coffee, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Just great and super fast
customer_reviews.text: This moved faster than my Zoe double since my kids are weighing it down so much but i like hanging stuff off the handles so this stroller is not ideal for that unless you got your kid in the stroller sure. Just remember to remove the stuff hanging off the handle that could tip the stroller if your kid were to get out. But overall, its a great stroller. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Emz

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Stroller
customer_reviews.text: We have a nice (expensive) large stroller, but we needed something for traveling. This stroller is light weight and folds easily. I've had umbrella strollers in the past and hated them because they were too short for me (I'm 5'8"), this one is taller and comfortable for me to push without felling like I'm hunching over or stepping on the wheels. After having this for a few weeks I bought a second one for Grandma to keep in her car. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella stroller I’ve ever seen. Middle abdomen height handles. Back wheels are slopes forward so you can walk with full strides without hitting your foot on the wheels. Big bottom storage/ upper storage bag big enough for mail and keys w/ wallet. The seat reclines for the kid. 2 stage sun visor. Cup holder. This thing is the Porsche of umbrella strollers. Plus it’s super light and it has a strap so you can throw it over your shoulder. A gallon of milk weighs about the same as the stroller. It’s got a huge thumbs up from our family. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bevirt

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The wheels roll smooth and easily against the cobblestone. I live in Germany and some sidewalks seem narrow but this stroller is not to big for the narrow streets. I’m 5’5 and the handle bars seem a bit on the tall side for me but it is not an issue, so for you taller folks out there it would be perfect for you. It’s definitely bigger than an umbrella stroller but it still takes up less room in our suv as opposed to our other stroller which is huge. All in all, it’s a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Doejah

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had heard so many great things about this stroller and was excited to order one when it went on sale. However I was disappointed. The visor arrived bent with it leaning to one side, and with an obvious dent in the visor frame. The visor isn't very big and doesn't provide much protection from the sun. Also, I didn't think it was easy to fold. I decided to return and spend a little more money on a more quality umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to fold!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! I bought it to travel alone with my 4m old, and I can easily fold it down 1 handed and carry it while carrying the baby. Doesn’t take up a ton of trunk space either! I love that it can recline to multiple positions and has storage underneath, as well as a pocket on the back. The only thing I don’t totally love is the canopy (it’s pretty flimsy and doesn’t cover much), but that’s not a big deal for me. Definitely worth the money rather than spending tons on a more expensive umbrella stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: It works.  It's light.  It's cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I agonize over gear. I agonized over buying a travel stroller too, but ended up with this one based on reviews. It didn't disappoint - no issues so far after 6 flights, and out 1-year-old seems to enjoy it. She also naps happily in it -- the recline is excellent. One ding: the sunshade is pretty small, but most of them are on lightweight strollers (with some exceptions).
customer_reviews.author: BrookD

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use but basket is on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: the only reason this isn't a 5 star review is that I wish the basket were bigger and easier to access. Most diaper bags are on the bigger side these days and cramming ours in there is no easy feat and if you need to recline your child for any reason - forget about it. I love how easy this stroller is to move/push, open and close. You get used to the weird side-latch/back latch thing to open/close it. Baby finds it super comfortable and even though there is no drink/snack holder it is still a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality. Buy a better brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller because of the great reviews. I loved it when I got it. I bought it June 25, 2018 I didn't get to use it until July 4. With in a few months the back where was falling off I contacted the company and they sent me out a new one. The stroller didn't get used over winter so from Nov 2018- March 2019 it sat in my closet. I have been using it for about another month and the wheel fell off again. I have tried to pop it in several times and it just rolls out. It's VERY CHEAPLY made.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Robust Stroller - Great for Travelling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller two years ago and it continues to amaze me in its robustness. We just took it on a week long European vacation where we pushed my 30+ pound daughter up and down cobblestone streets in this thing. Granted it was a bumpy ride for my daughter and I kept expecting for one of the wheels to eventually just fly off, but this stroller kept on going! We have a nice Bugaboo as well but for long trips, I keep going to this stroller as it's very easy to transport and does the job. Plus at this price, if the airline messes it up or someone steals it, I won't be too upset. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for traveling. Make sure you pay careful attention to the instructions. My husband accidentally put the wheels on wrong and it was really hard to get off. Aside from the issue, which was completely our mistake, I highly recommend this for anyone needing a stroller that is easy to travel with and won't take up so much room in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: nmrtx5

customer_reviews.title: The best there is
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this stroller. Bought it for an international trip with our lil' one. We have already started using it in the mall. The features I liked the most are 1. 5 point harness 2. full recline 3. light weight, easy folding and compact 4. front wheels are lockable, good breaks for the rear wheels 5. very good fabric quality and good basket size 6. Cant beat the price for the quality and features it has I really don't care for the cup holder they provided( too small- sticks out oddly) everything else about this stroller is amazing. Its a wonderful stroller that can be used anywhere the floor/road is smooth and nice (definitely not for hiking :))
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great except folding
customer_reviews.text: I took a trip to New Jersey and it worked great as far as keeping up with the amount of walking we did averaging about 6 miles a day in New York and New Jersey. The only thing was the folding is not as easy as it looks. The outside lever has to be pulled first then the back handle has to be pulled up. Must be done in that order or it will not fold. I struggled with this most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love how easy this stroller is to push. The wheels don't get stuck, which was a huge reason I didn't want another cheapie umbrella. My cons: --cupholder-super flimsy. We got a universal stroller caddy from a baby shower that attaches in between the handles that works beautifully. --the shade-I wish it weren't affixed to the stroller; it really is only effective when the sun is directly overhead. --the storage basket-not so much storage. Not a deal breaker! Overall, I'm really happy with this stroller and baby seems MUCH more comfortable than a cheaper umbrella. We love that it reclines as well.
customer_reviews.author: lifeisgood

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a nice stroller with good price; however, my son installed the left front wheel in the wrong direction (the arrow should point upward) and it stuck and there is no way to uninstall it. So the stroller is a piece of trash now just for a small mistake that the manufacuerer should offered a better design to install and diessmble. Lost 70$ for that primitive design.
customer_reviews.author: bader almutairi

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to City Mini and hello summer infant
customer_reviews.text: Wow just wow. My two year old loves it and mommy loves and daddy loves it. It's lightweight easy to fold and compact has a carrying strap decent sun coverage compared to other lightweight strollers decent cargo for being lightweight. RECLINES all the way in a very easy way I must add and it comes with a cup holder. I had a city Mini by baby jogger per every mommy saying it was the must have and met me tell you I hated it. Other than the super easy fold it sucks and it's clunky and 21 lbs was not lightweight. This summer infant 3D is a total game changer and everything I wanted in a stroller.
customer_reviews.author: ERIKA B

customer_reviews.title: I have not found a better lightweight stroller that comes with all the features that ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not found a better lightweight stroller that comes with all the features that this has. Such as: reclining seat, storage basket, sun shade, cup holder, and the CARRYING STRAP. I think the strap is the best feature because many have handles or nothing at all and when I go up or down any stairs with my toddler I cant hold her hand and the railing or a big bag or toy if i have to carry the stroller too. The strap leaves my hands free.
customer_reviews.author: blackcat2031

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great stroller! We had one that was for more jogging. It had actual tires instead of the hard ones like this one has. But we love this stroller so much more than our other one that was 170+. I totally recommend this stroller to anyone looking! It was such a great buy! And our boy loves being in it! The only think that I wish would change is the lower compartment at the bottom it is hard to get my purse in and out of it.
customer_reviews.author: mommaA

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this stroller
customer_reviews.text: After doing SO much stroller research, and mainly looking at the more expensive strollers, I took a chance and went with this stroller for my 22 month old. BEST DECISION. I wanted something light weight, that reclines, and can easily be pushed on all types of ground. I've had this stroller for a few months now and have pushed it through sandy beaches, gravel, grass, and have had no problems doing so. My on the go son loves sitting in, has fell asleep in it, and I love that the straps are so easy to connect. Over all, a great buy and another good review for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Trigg

customer_reviews.title: Very good stroller
customer_reviews.text: Work well! Very easy to assemble and it's light and fits great in our trunk. Super easy to unfold and fold. Wish the seat reclined more. And the cup holder is too loose, I've spilt my drink several times simply from bumping into it. But over all I am pleased. The sun shade is awesome, the sun is never in my baby's eyes which I'm quite happy about. And the handle height is great for me being 5'10". Could easily work well for anyone who is 6 foot, but taller than that you may need to stoop a little. Great compact stroller for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany HooksTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have this stroller especially now that my daughter is 14 months old..she wants to sit up and see everything. This is way more convenient to use and maneuver than the fancy carseat stroller system we had. This stroller is lightweight, easy taking in and out of the trunk of my Honda Civic, unfolds easily, and the shoulder strap makes carrying a breeze. I love that this deluxe unbrella stroller reclines, has a large basket below, cup holder, pocket for keys or cell phone, a large canopy for shade, easy to push around and great height of handlebars for my tall husband. My daughter is comfortable in the seatbelt, adjusting the straps and buckling her in is easy.
customer_reviews.author: A mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: As far as strollers go, this one strikes a very good balance of "good" and "cheap." Yes, you can buy a $200 stroller that feels like you're pushing your child along a laser-flat ice rink at any given moment, but this one folds up/down quickly and is about 10x better than the umbrella stroller we bought for half the price at Target. Perfect for what we needed, and we don't feel bad if we scratch it or bang it against things when we load it in the car.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hartford

customer_reviews.title: SUCH A GREAT LITTLE STROLLER
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use in the airport for travel but find that we use it now as our everyday go-to stroller instead of our bulky Uppababy Vista. This thing is so lightweight and easy to maneuver. The hood isn't the best quality, it has a flimsy plastic structure but overall we are very happy for the price. We also wished it folded up smaller but it works for what we need. Basket storage is adequate for a stuffed annimal and a small bag, not a fully loaded diaper bag that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Great “city” stroller small but comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: We have had a BOB for both of our boys and lived it but it is HUGE! So for this vacation we decided to buy a smaller stroller. I have loved having a small stroller it was awesome at the airport and was easy to go through security and gate check. Also love this for shopping as it easily fits in stores. I also really like that it doesn’t take up my whole suv! The only thing that I notice is that it doesn’t go all that great in rough terrain such as the beach, trails, or grass so that is when I still use my BOB stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Anita M Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wheels need improvement. Over all awesome stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I looked and looked for strollers for my baby. Finally decided on this one. Arrived quickly easy to assemble. I liked that the seat could recline and had a nice size basket under the seat. This stroller is made for taller people my husband is 6'4" and can push the stroller easily without having to bend over. Now for the dislikes. There's really only 1 thing that stands out that needs improvement., the wheels are made of some foam material and they don't grip the ground well. Other then that this is a great stroller
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! We needed something more compact than our Recaro Denali for road trips. This fits relatively well. I wish that it was slightly shorter when folded as it won't fitlying down in the back of our suv without removing the wheels. Those are easy-ish to remove at least. It would be nice if unlocking the brakes was a little easier. It would also be nice if you could lean back the backrest with one hand instead of two. It can wake the baby if you accidentally let it fall because you've got two hands unlocking it and trying to use your arm to prevent the baby from falling. Overall it's a great stroller. Especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love love this stroller! My friend recommended it to us as we were traveling aboard with an infant. This stroller literally saved our lives and made our trip super easy. It is safe, easy to clean, light wight, easy to assemble and fold. Very satisfied with this purchase and would really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Limitless...

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this a few times so far but love it so much more than another umbrella stroller I picked up for free. The handle height is amazing (I'm 5' 11"). This is by far the best feature! I like that I can walk without kicking the wheels/bars (another issue with the other stroller). The reclining feature will be nice for longer ventures. The sun shade isn't really a great option but I can let it go in exchange for the other pluses. Straps are a little challenging to tighten but that's the case with most nylon straps.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rowe

product_meta.title: Summer 3Dlite Convenience Stroller, Green – Lightweight Stroller with Aluminum Frame, Large Seat Area, 4 Position Recline, Extra Large Storage Basket – Infant Stroller for Travel and More
product_meta.description:
Color:Green| Style:3DliteThe 3D lite Convenience Stroller is a durable stroller that has a lightweight and stylish aluminum frame and is one of the lightest and most feature rich convenience strollers on the market. With an easy to fold frame and carry strap, you can be on-the-go or stow and go with ease.Versatile Wheels- The front wheels can either lock in place for navigating cobblestone roads and uneven surfaces or swivel for walking on smooth pavement and flat surfaces - precision steering for you and baby on-the-go.

BRAND STORY
By Summer Infant
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT – A lightweight stroller makes any outing a little easier! The Summer 3Dlite Convenience Stroller has a durable aluminum frame that weighs just 13 pounds and has a large seat area, plus anti-shock front wheels and lockable rear wheels

FOR TRAVEL AND EVERYDAY – Whether you’re traveling or just on the go running everyday errands, having a lightweight, compact stroller is a must! With this one easy to use stroller, you’ll have both an everyday and travel stroller option
4-POSITION RECLINE - Keep your little one comfortable and safe at all times with the 4 position recline and 5 point safety harness. Maximum weight of child for this toddler stroller: 50 pounds

COMPACT FOLD – The easy compact fold with carry strap and auto lock makes it simple to store this lightweight umbrella stroller and bring it with you to go! Plus, the adjustable and removable canopy with flip out sun visor is perfect for sunny days

EXTRA STORAGE – With plenty of storage in this stroller, you won’t have to leave anything at home. It includes an extra-large storage basket, rear storage pocket and cup holder. Don’t overload storage basket: maximum of 10 lbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,956 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
